title: Volkswagen Passat GTE review: a classy plug-in hybrid for those who don't want a diesel
text:
It’s out there, the Volkswagen Passat. You know it is. It’s Volkswagen’s longest-serving model, having been launched in 1973, and there are thousands of them on our roads. VW sold 12,450 of the things last year alone.

And yet, you don’t really see them, do you? Passats rather fade into the background. Not because they’re bad; rather the opposite, in fact. They’re ubiquitous because they are – and always have been – very good at what they do. So incessantly competent is the Passat, in fact; so without endearing chinks in its armour of brilliance, that it ends up cursed with a reputation for being, well, just a bit boring.

Indeed, you might not even have been aware that a new Passat has just gone...
description: It’s out there, the Volkswagen Passat.
